sentences: Ludvig tundis hobuses oma talvise patsienti, kes kabjamädanikuga neilloomaravilas oli.
context: The word 'patsient' in Estonian is a noun that refers to a patient - someone who receives medical care or treatment from doctors. It can be used for any type of medical facility, including hospitals and dental offices. The word appears to follow standard Estonian grammar with the '-i' ending indicating partitive case (accusative) here.
